Comment: A bit passive - allows me to get a big pawn centre. I like to play a Pirc - 1. e4 d6 2. d4 Nf6 (pretty much forcing  3. Nc3, so I can't play c4 first), although I tend to lose if white playes 4. f4

Now after 20. ... a6 21. Nc7 Ra7 (21. ... Rb8 is better) 22. Re7 Qxd6 23. Ne6+ Kg8 24. Qh6 I threaten mate on g7, because fxe6 opens the rook and Nh5 fails to Re8 - this is why Rb8 is better - so black has to sacrifice the queen. What I failed to notice was 1: black can capture on d6 after Nc7, and 2: after Nxa8, my rook is hanging. Maybe moving the bishop (Bc2) may be better, as the d6 pawn will be defended after a move of the knight.
So I sacrificed the bishop. capturing it brings about the same lines (except the back rank mate doesn't work because of the rook on a8), and now my pawn is protected.
